title: Service Desk Agent (Bilingual – English, Español)
description:
Se trata de una gran oportunidad para trabajar en una empresa global con una gran base de usuarios. Será el enlace de soporte de primera línea para la comunidad de usuarios finales. Se requiere experiencia en soporte técnico telefónico con la capacidad de solucionar problemas, analizar, priorizar, resolver y/o facilitar problemas para lograr una resolución para el cliente.

Restablecimiento de contraseñas, problemas de directorio activo. Acceso remoto a PCs y resolución de problemas.

Funciones:

Recibir solicitudes de servicio por teléfono, correo electrónico o sesión de chat.

Aplicar técnicas de diagnóstico para identificar problemas, investigar causas y recomendar soluciones para corregir fallos comunes.

En la medida de lo posible, solucionar los problemas en la primera llamada.

Utilizar la base de conocimientos interna, la experiencia y los recursos del equipo.

Remitir las incidencias a los grupos de asistencia adecuados cuando sea necesario.

Documentar el problema en la base de datos.

Realizar un seguimiento de los problemas abiertos con los grupos de escalado para proporcionar información al cliente.

Realizar un control de calidad de los tickets resueltos para garantizar la satisfacción del cliente.

Zona Providencia.

description:
We Believe in Better!

We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.

At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.

title: Reconciliation Associate
description:
HeadQuarters, a global start-up, is seeking a Reconciliation Associate to join their team in the accounting department. The Reconciliation Associate will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting by maintaining records of all financial transactions. This includes working with different departments within the organization to verify the accuracy of financial data and reconciling accounts on a regular basis. The position will also provide support for other functions within the accounting department. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team and contribute to the growth of a company that partners with US cannabis companies to provide support in finance, sales operations, and logistics.


Responsibilities

  • Reconcile general ledger accounts on a regular basis to ensure accuracy of financial records
  • Prepare daily reconciliations of bank accounts
  • Ensure accuracy and completeness of accounts payable and accounts receivable
  • Maintain fixed asset records and ensure that the depreciation and amortization schedules are accurate
  • Assist with monthly closing process and preparation of monthly financial statements
  • Support audit requirements by preparing schedules and supporting documentation
  • Collaborate with different departments within the organization to verify the accuracy of financial data

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related field
  • 2-3 years of relevant experience in a similar role
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel
  • Experience with accounting software, preferably QuickBooks
  • Solid understanding of accounting principles and practices
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and deadlines
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Learning and development advisor / consultant
  • Salary increase opportunities based on performance
  • Work with largest companies in the cannabis industry ($10M+ monthly revenues)
  • Learn on the best accounting stack - Oracle, Sage, Xero, QBO Advanced & Python dev support

title: Brand Payments Associate
description:
You will be working with our client Nabis. They are a fully-licensed cannabis third- party distributor and wholesale platform with the largest portfolio of cannabis brands in the world, supplying 100% of California’s dispensaries, financials and delivery services. This is a cost effective cannabis distribution center that allows entrepreneurs to develop brands without any bottlenecks and restrictions. You will be working closely with our client’s accounting teams (cash application predominantly). As a Remittance Associate / Brand Payments Specialist, you will be responsible for manufacturer transfer preparations. Your main responsibility will be to perform an analysis of all the invoices and cash collected, and later subtract the 10% fees for collecting the cash along with taxes. You will then prepare a detailed report to share with the manufacturers along with the money transfer. This job is ideal for someone who enjoys working with numbers and would like to learn how to use various accounting tools, as well as participate in process improvements.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform invoice and cash collection analysis
  • Prepare detailed reports
  • Maintain client communication (regular contact with brands)

Requirements

  • Advanced English proficiency
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Economics (Accounting)
  • Accounting background is preferred
  • Problem-solving skills Knowledge of Microsoft Excel
  • Attention to detail skills
  • The learning agility to master using an array of different accounting software, as well as newly introduced software in a short period of time

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Learning and development advisor / consultant
  • Salary increase opportunities based on performance
  • Work with largest companies in the cannabis industry ($10M+ monthly revenues)
  • Learn on the best accounting stack - Oracle, Sage, Xero, QBO Advanced & Python dev support

title: Technical Process Specialist
description:
BIOptimizers is seeking a disciplined, detail-oriented, proactive and collaborative Technical Process Specialist to help convert our key recurring tasks into world class processes. This role will be responsible for SYSTEMS AND PROCESS CREATION, MAINTENANCE, OPTIMIZATION and ensuring these systems are actually followed and adhered to by team members.

Our company is growing fast. We're looking for someone who already loves systems to help manage the transformation of our company into a systems-centered business that is dedicated to following processes and procedures (and rejects the ad hoc style of working). This will ensure we maintain the highest of standards as we grow our teams with new members, technologies and processes.

There are increasing demands for the organization to create and execute technical processes. We are looking for someone with a desire to make technical processes and procedures effective and efficient in capturing and documenting the KEY recurring-task PROCESSES (performed by our best performers) into LINEAR Step-by-Step Documented SYSTEMS.

The impact here is HUGE.

Your primary focus will be on creating easy to follow processes within and across departments, enhancing communication and increasing productivity as our team grows.

Responsibilities & Objectives

  • CORE ROLE: Capture key recurring task processes (performed by our best performers) and turn them into linear step-by-step documented systems that everyone can follow.
  • CORE ROLE: Promote a systems and processes driven team culture though team support and leading by example. Set the tone for how our processes should be followed by all.
  • Advocate and ensure that every team member is aware and follows all implemented systems within the organization.
  • Develop, write, edit and maintain up to date systems and instructions..
  • Assist in the development of a system-thinking culture within BIOptimizers.
  • Collaborate with all areas of the organization and the leadership team to identify areas of priority for system documentation.
  • Collect, analyze and document requirements from requesting teams for software/tech requests.
  • Collaborate with requesting teams and the tech team to translate requirements into action steps to align software development with objectives and requests.
  • Create technical processes through documentation, diagrams, and use stories to communicate technical functionality to the requesting team.
  • Continuously review documentation for accuracy and effectiveness and improvement opportunities as team needs evolve.
  • Conduct reviews of documentation, update requirements based on evolving business needs.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Background with tech and/ or software (virtual, not physical)
  • 1+ years of experience using Google Suite tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Forms)
  • Possess a powerful ability to distill information into its most basic, simple and "easy to understand" essence/steps.
  • You'll be extremely detail-oriented by nature (you'll be hard-wired this way), with a passion for systems, staying organized, and always wanting to make things better than they already are.
  • You need to be a superstar documenting and organizing information while in constant collaboration with team members to ensure systems are up to date with our best practices.
  • Exceptional English writing and verbal communications.
  • Available to work full-time on the Eastern Time Zone.

Leading Team Member Candidates:

  • 1+ years of experience in creating SOPs creating custom software (strong advantage)
  • Experience with Atlassian’s Jira software for project and task management.
  • Passionate about health, wellness and the pursuit of superhuman health.
  • Ability to lead teams in creating systems from various sources (Videos, Screenshots, verbal interviews, etc.)
  • Stay up to date and continue to study new approaches to meet and improve above objectives.
  • Teach and guide team members on the company’s ways of working.
  • Experience within software specific to RETAIL before

Compensation:

For U.S. applicants: Across all US locations, the base salary range for this full-time position is $17-20 per hour. Our pay ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Perks List:

  • Vacation, Sick, Maternity and Bereavement Leave
  • BiOptimizers Health Boosting Formulas (Value at $2,400/year)
  • Free Books and Courses (Thousands a year)
  • Free personalized Nootropics (Value at $3,600/year)
  • EFT Sessions
  • Career strengths-based coaching
  • A tight-knit team of outgoing professionals

What to Expect during the selection process:

  • Application: your profile and resume will be reviewed within 72 hours, and you’ll hear back from us no matter what (no ghosting!). We aim to respond to every applicant within 5 business days.
  • Predictive Index Assessment: All candidates need to complete a behavioral and cognitive assessment through Predictive Index. This tool is an integral part of our hiring process and crucial to limiting bias. You can find out more about Predictive Index here.
  • Google Meet Interview: a 30-minute video call with two of our Talent Acquisition Specialists to get to know you a bit better and make sure you are aligned with our company core values.
  • Job specific Skill Assessment: Hands on related test.
  • 15-minute Phone Meeting with Trevor: Informal short "Get to know each other" to gauge if the chemistry is right to be successful together (We do not solely hire for skill, as a new skill is easy to train, we are looking for the right team member to build on our success).
  • Panel Interview: a 60-minute video call with Adnan (Chief Technology Officer), Andy (Chief Operating Officer), Haley (Systems Coordinator) and someone from our Talent Acquisition team to discuss your background, BIOptimizers, and answer your questions about the team and growth trajectory.
  • Reference Check: At this point, we will ask for some references to email as part of our due diligence.
  • Offer: Ideally, this is the part where we make the offer, you accept, and we all celebrate!

Additional Application Information

Tech Requirements:

  • Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 4GB RAM
  • Internet Speed - At least 20 MBPS Download speed

This role is 100% remote so reliable internet is a must. The company is US based however the company is distributed remotely across the globe.

In order to be considered for the position you MUST apply through our career portal using this link: Job Application for Technical Process Specialist at Careers at BIOptimizers (greenhouse.io)

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $290.00 - $340.00 per hour

Work Location: Remote

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
As an Accounts Payable Associate, you will be keeping track of payments and performing bookkeeping tasks for both external and internal accounts. The tasks you will be given have a standardized order and are performed either on a daily, weekly or monthly basis. You will communicate with an expert team of accountants and managers, as well as resolving any issues with accounts payable/receivable and cash application team.


Responsibilities:

  • Review and record payments
  • Assist in period closes and prepare journal entries, as well as reconcile accounts
  • Manage and find ways to improve upon the accounts payable processes
  • Participate in preparation of monthly reports and data analysis
  • Maintain regular client communication and strengthen the relationships with clients through timely payment
  • Participate in ongoing new projects, such as creating standard operating procedure documents
  • Communicate and participate in daily and weekly meetings with the rest of the accounting team

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Economics (Accounting)
  • 2-3 years of accounting experience
  • Prior experience in accounts payable (or accounts receivable)
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Google Suite
  • Experience with accounting software and online platforms
  • Attention to detail skills

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Learning and development advisor / consultant
  • Salary increase opportunities based on performance
  • Work with largest companies in the cannabis industry ($10M+ monthly revenues)
  • Learn on the best accounting stack - Oracle, Sage, Xero, QBO Advanced & Python dev support

title: Cash Application Associate
description:
HeadQuarters, a global cannabis industry start-up, is seeking a Cash Application Associate to join its growing accounting team. This role will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely processing of cash receipts for our US cannabis company partners. As a member of the HeadQuarters team, you will be part of an innovative and collaborative culture that is committed to supporting the rapidly expanding legal cannabis industry in the United States.


Responsibilities

  • Perform daily cash application activities
  • Reconcile daily application with bank statements
  • Research discrepancies and work closely with functional teams to ensure application accuracy
  • Maintain electronic funds transfers and check log capture
  • Assist with overpayment tracking and accounts receivable reconciliation

Requirements

  • Advanced English skills (both written and verbal)
  • Bachelor's Degree in Finance / Business Administration
  • Accounting background is preferred
  • Proficiency in Google Spreadsheets / Excel
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Prefers working in a team environment
  • Strong analytical skills / attention to detail
  • Previous experience in either QuickBooks / SAP / GetPaid platform is preferred

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Learning and development advisor / consultant
  • Salary increase opportunities based on performance
  • Work with largest companies in the cannabis industry ($10M+ monthly revenues)
  • Learn on the best accounting stack - Oracle, Sage, Xero, QBO Advanced & Python dev support

title: Accounting Supervisor
description:
HeadQuarters, a global start-up that provides support in finance, sales operations, and logistics to US cannabis companies, is seeking a qualified Accounting Supervisor to join its growing team. In this role, you will oversee daily accounting operations and ensure that financial reports are prepared in an accurate and timely manner. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will also be responsible for managing accounting software, generating financial statements, and implementing new accounting policies and procedures.

At HeadQuarters, we believe that our work has the potential to transform the rapidly growing cannabis industry. Our mission is to provide a range of critical services that allow businesses to thrive, while also promoting ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to supporting a diverse and inclusive work environment, and we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.


Responsibilities

  • Oversee daily transactions, including accounts payable/receivable, general ledger and bank reconciliations
  • Participate in regular tax audits and payroll
  • Support month-end and year-end closing
  • Help organize financial data into useable information and maintain updated records
  • Track the progress of financial and accounting objectives
  • Establish accounting policies and procedures, aligned with company’s targets

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field
  • Minimum of 5 years of accounting experience, with at least 2 years of supervisory experience
  • Strong knowledge of GAAP and accounting principles and best practices
  • Proficient in accounting software, such as QuickBooks, Xero, or similar
  • Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with team members at all levels of the organization
  • Familiarity with the cannabis industry and related regulations is a plus

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Learning and development advisor / consultant
  • Salary increase opportunities based on performance
  • Work with largest companies in the cannabis industry ($10M+ monthly revenues)
  • Learn on the best accounting stack - Oracle, Sage, Xero, QBO Advanced & Python dev support

title: Senior Mainframe Developer with Life Insurance
description:
Project Description

Luxoft DXC Technology Company is an established company focusing on consulting and implementation of complex projects in the financial industry. At the interface between technology and business, we convince with our know-how, well-founded methodology and pleasure in success. As a reliable partner to our renowned customers, we support them in planning, designing and implementing the desired innovations. Together with the customer, we deliver top performance!

For one of our Client in the Insurance Segment, we are searching for a Mainframe Developer with Life Insurance domain experience.

Responsibilities

    • development
    • managing production batch cycles along with resolution abend
    • preparing metrics reports
    • working with code integration repository

Skills

Must have

    • 6 -8 years of Strong Experience of development in the following mainframe skills (COBOL, VSAM, MFE, IBM,DB2 Tools)
    • Must have strong understanding of LIFE Insurance domain [TL, UL, VUL, Annuity products]
    • Experience of managing production batch cycles along with resolution abend
    • Should be able to do estimations as required
    • Should have good experience managing JIRA / SNOW dashboards
    • Good communication & presentation skills and should be able to prepare various metrics report for client and present them monthly / quarterly business review
    • Preferred - LOMA 280/290 certifications
    • Have good analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Be a self-motivated individual who works well in a global team environment.
    • Experience in code integration repository like GIT and Agile Development Practices
    • Demonstrate effective communication and coordination with all stake holders
    • Advanced English language skills

Nice to have

    .

Languages

English: C1 Advanced

Seniority

Senior

Relocation package

If needed, we can help you with relocation process.

Vacancy Specialization

Cobol (Mainframe)

title: Real Estate Administrative Clerk
description:
Position: Office Administrative Clerk (Remote)

A mobile home park company is seeking an energetic office administrative clerk to provide business operations support for their growing real estate business. We are looking for an individual with excellent presentation, organizational, proactive and sales/leasing skills. The ideal candidate will have a strong service background, attention to detail and a willingness to be part of a team. This is a full-time position from Monday through Friday, with working hours from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm PDT.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain positive relations with residents, staff, main office, vendors and officials.
  • Handle general back-office duties and maintain files.
  • Prepare legal notices
  • Manage eviction files
  • Manage delinquency and communicate virtually with residents and office managers
  • Report any problems to the Park Owner or Supervisor.
  • Coordinate maintenance issues.
  • Assist in creating and updating property and office rules and regulations.
  • Bill residents in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Enter Utility readings and calculations monthly.
  • Generate and distribute monthly rent statements.
  • Prepare and submit weekly and monthly reports to ownership.
  • Maintain vendor and contractor files to ensure compliance.
  • Prepare and review vendor contracts for new projects.
  • Generate and file new leases for new and current residents.
  • Submit past balances to the collection agency.
  • Conduct various property management related audits .

Requirements

  • Minimum of 2 years of executive assistant experience with US-based businesses
  • Bachelor's degree in business administration preferred but not required
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Ability to write, speak and interact clearly and professionally.
  • Extremely organized. Strong multitasking and time-management skills.
  • Can handle sensitive information with the highest degree of integrity and confidentiality
  • Reliable internet/WiFi and excellent audio quality with minimal to zero background noise
  • Advanced English (Spoken and written)
  • Must have a strong work ethic and track record delivering results
  • Must have excellent attention to detail.
  • You must be reliable and show up on time.

Payment

  • Monthly Base Salary is $1500 USD
  • Payments are processed and sent via Wise or similar platform at an established frequency (twice a month)

title: Becario de Operaciones logísticas
description:
• IMPORTANTE: Solo personas interesadas en liberación de prácticas profesionales, *NO HAY APOYO ECONÓMICO

Empresa de Freight Forwarder, con más de 30 años de operaciones en el sector, se encuentra en búsqueda de talento joven para su programa de prácticas profesionales, en un esquema 100% Home Office y apoyando a las actividades de la empresa ¡Únete al equipo de Operaciones!

Si eres:

  • Estudiante de los últimos semestres o egresado de Negocios Internacionales, Relaciones Internacionales, Logística o afín.
  • Tienes interés por aprender temas de Logística y Cadena de Suministro. Conocer los procesos que se llevan a cabo desde un Freight Forwarder en el ámbito logístico (interno y externo)
  • Disponibilidad de horario de 4 horas diarias.
  • Equipo de cómputo y conexión a Internet estable.

¿Cómo es un día normal?

  • Transmisiones de exportación
  • Apertura de expedientes en sistema
  • Revisión de temas administrativos (Costeos, proformar facturas, ingresar solicitudes de pago a proveedores)
  • Documentar expedientes en sistema
  • Solicitar recolección, reservaciones con aerolíneas
  • Emisión de cartas porte

IMPORTANTE: Solo personas interesadas en liberación de prácticas profesionales, NO HAY APOYO ECONÓMICO
